archetype_name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
name: Sheet-Pan Halloumi with Zucchini, Tomatoes & Lemon Orzo
description: Hands-off roasted halloumi, zucchini, and tomatoes with olives and oregano, served over bright lemon orzo. Family-friendly and chili-free with Greek–Middle Eastern flavors.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large sheet pan.
Cut zucchini into half-moons (1 cm thick).
Slice red onion into thick wedges.
Cut halloumi cheese into 2 cm cubes and pat dry.
Zest and juice the lemon; keep separate.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the orzo.
cook_steps: On the sheet pan, toss zucchini, cherry tomatoes, and red onion with olive oil, oregano, salt, and black pepper; spread in a single layer.
Remove pan, add halloumi cheese and olives, toss gently, and roast 10–12 minutes more until halloumi is golden at the edges.
While the pan roasts, cook orzo in boiling salted water until al dente (about 8–10 minutes); drain well.
Return orzo to the pot and stir in a drizzle of olive oil, lemon zest, half the lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Taste the sheet-pan mix and add a little lemon juice if desired.
Serve lemon orzo in bowls topped with the roasted halloumi and vegetables; finish with parsley.
